data.title: Cotton University : Rankings, Courses, Fees
data.meta_description: Cotton University, formerly known as Cotton College, is a public state university located in Guwahati, Assam, India. It was established in...
data.text:
The University is a well-respected institution of higher learning in India. It has been ranked among the top 200 universities in the country by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF). The university has a strong faculty, a well-equipped library, and a variety of other facilities.

The university is also home to a number of research centers and institutes. These centers conduct research in a variety of areas, including science, technology, social sciences, and humanities. The university’s research output is highly regarded in India and abroad. The University is a vibrant and diverse community. Students from all over India and the world come to study at the university. The university is committed to providing a stimulating and supportive environment for all of its students.

The University is ranked 289th in India and 5633rd in the world in the 2023 overall rankings by EduRank. It is also ranked 150-200 in India by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) in 2020. The university offers a wide range of undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral programs in arts, science, commerce, and law. It has a strong faculty and a good infrastructure. The university also has a good placement record.

Here are some of the rankings of CU :-

The fees for UG courses at University range from ₹4,450 to ₹1,33,000 per year. PG courses are slightly more expensive, with fees ranging from ₹4,850 to ₹90,600 per year. Doctoral programs are the most expensive, with fees ranging from ₹35,220 to ₹1,28,000 per year.

The eligibility criteria for admission to UG courses at University vary depending on the course. However, in general, candidates must have passed 10+2 with a minimum of 50% marks. For PG courses, candidates must have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline with a minimum of 50% marks.

The University releases the results of its examinations online on its official website. You can check the results by entering your roll number and date of birth. The results are usually released a few weeks after the completion of the examinations.

Here are the steps on how to check your University result online :

The University has a good placement record, especially for its postgraduate students. In 2022, 13 undergraduate and 95 postgraduate students were placed. The median package offered to undergraduate students was INR 5.34 LPA, while the median package offered to postgraduate students was INR 3.62 LPA and INR 3.80 LPA, respectively.

The University campus was founded in 1901 by Sir Henry Stedman Cotton, the Chief Commissioner of the erstwhile British province of Assam. The campus is spread over 4.59 acres and is home to a number of heritage buildings, including the Chemistry Department, the Principal’s Bunglow, and the Dr. Suryya Kumar Bhuyan Library. The campus has also been a center of the freedom movement and the literary and cultural movements of the state.

The Main Building is the oldest and most iconic building on the University campus. It is a two-story structure with a red-brick exterior and a white-pillared portico. The building houses the administrative offices of the university, as well as classrooms, lecture halls, and a library.

Christ Church Cathedral was built on land that was originally part of the University campus. The cathedral is now a National Historic Landmark, and the university campus is located nearby. The two institutions have a long history of cooperation, and they continue to work together to serve the community.
